text:
Over 61 killed and 70 injured after a speeding train ran over people who were gathered to watch the burning of Ravana effigy on the occasion of Hindu festival Dussehra. The tragic incident took place in Joda Fatak area where over 700 people were gathered to be a part of the Dussehra celebrations.
Agencies
All the 70-odd people injured in the train accident are in critical conditions, officials said on Saturday. This tragic incident has again put a very big question mark on the level of security at public places.
Questioning the same, several Bollywood celebrities have reacted to this mishap and mourned the lives that were lost in this tragic incident.
Agencies
Pointing out at the lack of concrete security and safety measures, Farhan Akhtar took to Twitter to raise a valid point. He wrote,

"Saddened to hear about the loss of life in #Amritsar. Safety in public spaces HAS TO be taken a lot more seriously. Deepest condolences to all families affected by this tragedy."
Here is how the film fraternity reacted to the unfortunate series of events that happened since last evening.

Hope wish & pray, God gives enough strength to the bereaved family. My humble request to State & Central Govt to provide immediate assistance. — Shatrughan Sinha (@ShatruganSinha) October 19, 2018
So disturbed to see the visuals of #AmritsarTrainincident 😭 have no words to express how sad is the whole incident. Mere negligence could cost so many lives. Wish it was not true.
